text:
Xiaomi announced the Mi CC9 Pro. It has six cameras and a massive battery
05 Nov 2019, 07:58 by Daria Gromova
‚ÄúAlmost a flagship‚Äù with a 108 megapixel camera.
At a presentation in China, Xiaomi introduced the long-awaited Mi CC9 Pro - an improved version of Mi CC9. This is the second smartphone in the world (after Nokia 9 PureView) with a 5-module main camera.



The 6.47-inch AMOLED display is curved around the edges, supports HDR and has a resolution of 1080 x 2340 pixels. An optical fingerprint scanner is built into the display - it works correctly even if the finger is wet, and offers a wider scanning area. This is the first smartphone in the world with such a sensor.
A 32-megapixel selfie camera was placed in the drop-shaped recess. But the star of the program is, of course, the main camera. It consists of five modules, of which three were taken out into a separate island: this is the main 108 megapixel manufactured by Samsung, a 5 megapixel TV with support for 5x optical and 50x hybrid zoom, and a 12 megapixel portrait lens.



Two more modules were separately located: a super wide 20 MP with a viewing angle of 117 ¬∞, and a macro lens 2 MP. These five cameras are complemented by two LED flashes. In addition to shooting in high resolution, the Mi CC9 Pro also offers intelligent scene enhancement, super-night mode and 4K shooting.
The heart of the smartphone is the Snapdragon 730G processor - the less powerful flagship Snapdragon 855+, but still in the top segment among the manufacturer's chips. The battery capacity is an impressive 5,260 mAh. Fortunately, the company added 30 watts fast charging, so it charges from 0 to 100% in just 65 minutes.



Out of the box, the Mi CC9 Pro runs on MIUI 11 powered by Android 9 Pie. The firmware includes Game Turbo 2.0 game mode and a powerful speaker that produces sound "twice as loud as compared to the speakers of other smartphones." The smartphone supports Bluetooth 5.0, but retained a 3.5 mm headphone jack.
On November 5, Xiaomi opens pre-orders; on sale in China, the smartphone will arrive on November 11 in three colors: black, green and pearl white. The cost of new items is as follows:

6 GB + 128 GB - 2,799 yuan (‚âà25,270 rubles);
8 GB + 128 GB - 3 099 yuan (‚âà27 980 rubles);
8 GB + 256 GB - 3 499 yuan (‚âà31 590 rubles).

It is expected that Mi Note 10, which will be presented in Spain tomorrow, November 6, will become the European analogue of Mi CC9 Pro.
